title: Channel Islands National Park: Race to Save the White Abalone
body: Race to Save the White Abalone              Race to Save the White Abalone   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:8 minutes, 25 seconds  The white abalone, once an important commercial species along the southern California coast, may be close to biological extinction. Using a remotely operated underwater vehicle (ROV), a survey team from Channel Islands National Park, National Park Service Submerged Cultural Resources Unit, U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, National Marine Fisheries Service, and the Marine Conservation Biology Institute investigates the abundance and distribution of white abalone around the Channel Islands to obtain the latest estimates of the population status of the species.
